Description: Azure Service Bus must have local auth disabled
Configure customer-managed keys for encrypting Azure Service Bus data at rest
Service Bus Namespace should use TLS version 1.2 or higher to ensure secure communication.
Azure ServiceBus Namespace must be using premium SKU
Disable public access to Azure ServiceBus Namespace
IT Hygiene:  Azure Service Bus must be tagged per standards
Encryption at-rest: Use customer managed keys (CMK) to comply with CVS encryption standards
Disable public access to Azure Databricks
Deploy Azure Databricks workspace with Secure Cluster Connectivity (No Public IP)
IT Hygiene:  Azure Databricks must be tagged per standards
Azure Search Service must have local authentication enabled
Enforce customer managed key for encryption in Azure Search Service
Disable public access to Azure Search Service
IT Hygiene: Azure Search Service must be tagged per standards
Azure AI Language Service must have local authentication disabled
Enforce customer managed key for encryption in Azure AI Language Service
Disable public access to Azure AI Language Service
IT Hygiene: Azure AI Language Service must be tagged per standards
Azure AI Speech Service must have local authentication disabled
Enforce customer managed key for encryption in Azure AI Speech Service
Disable public access to Azure AI Speech Service
IT Hygiene: Azure AI Speech Service must be tagged per standards
Clusters must be labelled per standards
Clusters must use Release Channel for version management
Worker node boot disks must be encrypted using CMEK
Integrity Monitoring must be enabled for Shielded worker nodes for standard clusters
Worker nodes must have auto-repair feature turned on
Secure boot must be enabled that only runs authentic software by verifying the digital signature of all boot components
Default service should not be used when deploying composer environments
Composer environments should be deployed in approved regions useast4 uswest2 uscentral
Cloud Composer Environments must be encrypted with CVSH standard CMEK
Use Private IP mode network configuration Environment clusters should not have external IP addresses
Ensure cloud spanner db have deletion protection enabled
CMEK should be used in place of GMEK
Ensure cloud spanner is deployed in a valid US-region
Azure AI Translation Service must have local authentication disabled
Enforce customer managed key for encryption in Azure AI Translation Service
Disable public access to Azure AI Transaltion Service
IT Hygiene: Azure AI Translation Service must be tagged per standards
Azure AI Computer Vision Service must have local authentication disabled
Enforce customer managed key for encryption in Azure AI Computer Vision Service
Disable public access to Azure AI Computer Vision Service
IT Hygiene: Azure AI Computer Vision Service must be tagged per standards
Azure AI ContentSafety Service must have local authentication disabled
Enforce customer managed key for encryption in Azure AI ContentSafety Service
Disable public access to Azure AI ContentSafety Service
IT Hygiene: Azure AI ContentSafety Service must be tagged per standards
Azure Kubernetes Service Authentication must set to Azure RBAC
Kubernetes Local Accounts must be disabled
Azure Kubernetes Service cluster storage disks and all agent nodes at host must be encrypted using Customer managed encryption key.
Key Management Service (KMS v2) etcd encryption must be implemented to an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster
AKS Cluster public FQDN must be disabled
Use private IPs to restrict Dataflow workers from accessing resources outside of the VPC or peer networks enhancing security by limiting exposure
Ensure default service accounts are not being used by data pippelines
Datapipelines should be deployed in approved regions us-east4 us-west2 us-central1
Ensure customer managed encryption keys is being used at the time of data pipeline creation
Cloud DialogFlow Agents should be deployed in one of the approved locations
CMEK required on all instances for data-at-rest
Ensure Cloud DNS Zone type is set to PRIVATE
